Class LevelTwo

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
com.example.demo.Scene_Manipulator.Scene_Properties
com.example.demo.Levels.LevelTwo
public class LevelTwo extends Scene_Properties
The LevelTwo class represents the second level in the game. It manages the gameplay mechanics, including spawning enemies, tracking kills, and transitioning to the next level.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelTwo

      public LevelTwo(double screenHeight, double screenWidth)
      Constructs a new LevelTwo instance. Initializes the level with the appropriate background, player health, and background music.
      Parameters:
      screenHeight - The height of the screen.
      screenWidth - The width of the screen.

  • Method Details

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over by evaluating the user's status and kill count. If the user is destroyed, the game is lost. If the user has reached the required number of kills, the next level is triggered.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class Scene_Properties

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units for the level. This includes adding the user (player) to the scene.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class Scene_Properties

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units in the level. The number of enemies is limited by the total enemies for the level and a spawn probability. Enemies are added to the scene when the conditions are met.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class Scene_Properties

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected Level_Interface instantiateLevelView()
      Instantiates the level-specific view for LevelTwo. This view is responsible for rendering the visual elements specific to this level.
      Specified by:
      instantiateLevelView in class Scene_Properties
      Returns:
      The Level_Interface representing the level view.

    • userHasReachedKillTarget

      private boolean userHasReachedKillTarget()
      Helper method to check if the user has reached the required number of kills to advance to the next level.
      Returns:
      true if the user has reached the kill target, false otherwise.

    • handleGameOver

      private void handleGameOver()
      Handles the game over scenario, including stopping the background music.

    • proceedToNextLevel

      private void proceedToNextLevel()
      Proceeds to the next level when the kill target is met. Stops the current level's background music and transitions to the next level.

    • spawnEnemy

      private void spawnEnemy()
      Spawns a new enemy at a random Y position. The enemy starts at the right side of the screen.

    • playBackgroundMusic

      private void playBackgroundMusic()
      Plays the level background music. The music will loop indefinitely during the level.

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()
      Stops the background music if it's currently playing. This can be used when the level ends or when transitioning to another level.
      Overrides:
      stopMusic in class Scene_Properties
